website_summaries.verdict: The Almond 3 is a good router and smart-home hub, but we couldn't get our unit to work as a mesh network solution. We recommend the Eero or Netgear Orbi instead.
pros: As a single Wi-Fi router and smart-home hub, the Almond 3 succeeds with easy setup and decent speeds
It works with a ton of smart devices and includes voice-activation via Amazon Alexa
cons: As a Wi-Fi mesh system, the Almond 3 is unreliable, buggy and expensive

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. I had my main unit in a media cabinet, and after a few months of working, would randomly freeze. Cycling the power (unplugging it and plugging it back in) got it to reset. Over the next month, started to happen more frequently, until it was multiple times a day. Customer service insisted it was a heat issue, though problems continued after removing from the cabinet and placing it out in the open. Finally, securifi sent a replacement of one unit. Which only lasted another few months before the same problems presented themselves. Now is practically unusable after a little over a year from original purchase. I'm moving away from mesh networks until someone gets the technology down pat.
customer_reviews.author: maklein

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased three of these and used them to create a wireless mesh network in a 6,000 sq. ft. two story home. Had some challenges setting them up at first because I really didn't know what I was doing. Called Securifi tech support and the rep walked me through the entire setup process by telephone. They are now working perfectly! And the free Almond app gives you the ability to control access to the network from anywhere. Especially like the schedule feature which allows you to set access hours for the children's devices. All in all, this is an excellent product and I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: uncle-buck

customer_reviews.title: good but not good
customer_reviews.text: worked great for a year then when the R104 update i believe came though, i could no longer sign on to the almond cloud and the speed of the router slowed to about 1.98mbps down from 66.0. the reason for the 2 star review is in regards to customer service, they attempted to help me over the course of a week but even they were unable to figure out what the issue was, i would probably buy from the company again just not this product, i bought it almost at $100 if I'm not mistaken, and would have enjoyed getting more than 1 year good service then 6months intermittent service. now i must invest in new router.
customer_reviews.author: FamBam

customer_reviews.title: 1) The setup was easy. Plug it in and watch it go
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product for less than 30 days...I am contemplating returning it. HIGHS: 1) The setup was easy. Plug it in and watch it go. Onscreen instructions were easy to follow. 2) It works. LOWS: 1) A vertical line of white pixels has suddenly appeared in the middle of the screen. I have reset the machine (see below) but the line seems to be permanent. 2) I have randomly lost internet connection 2x now (in the last week). I have to turn off and restart the machine to get internet back. With my prior device I never lost connection. That's it for now...trying to decide whether to exchange or just return it for something more reliable.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Don't subject it to freezing temps
customer_reviews.text: Very simple set-up and incredibly user friendly. One of the better wifi routers I've ever used. Unfortunately, I stored it in a storage unit over the winter when I was moving, and it was subjected to freezing temperatures, which somehow affected the screen. Everything is now very faint and hard to read, but if you look very closely you can make out what the screen is saying and the touch screen still works, so I didn't totally ruin it. Would definitely recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Reller

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Had this thing for nine months now and it has consistently been a problem. Frequently drops connections and is often impossible to connect to once this happens. This forces a reboot. If this happened every once in a great while I could live with it. But every day!? No way. I'm hoping to return it cost-free since it was an Amazon Prime purchase. Otherwise, since it's garbage, it gets tossed out accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Worked for three years then died; screen started fading almost immediately
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for around 3 years before cutting out constantly and finally dying. During that period the screen started fading until I couldn't read it anymore. Same thing happened to my niece's. Can't recommend and won't buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Mkstr

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THESE
customer_reviews.text: These are ok if you have a small house and want to mesh your wifi especially if you don't know what you're doing. The touchscreen is great for folks who are not tech saavy. IF you know what you're doing DO NOT BUY THESE. Do yourself a favor and spend your money on something more widely used and known for their networking expertise. I won't say it but that manufacturer rhymes with SHMETGEAR. I want my money back! I got 4 of these &$&*%R($ things!
customer_reviews.author: ehnert34jm

customer_reviews.title: If you have used these before there is a change
customer_reviews.text: Used these for years, the newer ones require you to set up an account to use them! I just wanted to extend wifi range, not give up my information. If you don't care about things like privacy then these things are great.
customer_reviews.author: othercompguy

customer_reviews.title: Buy new and got an used None-US unit...
customer_reviews.text: I had the original Almond and almond 2. Both are great devices. Order the Almond 3 recently cause the 2 isn’t making the range I need to get my security cam working... I pay for a new item, the box came already open with face ripe out and in use condition... Worst part is that the power adopter for the unit is for none-us outlet. This is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: S. Chen

customer_reviews.title: Easy quick setup
customer_reviews.text: Easy quick setup. Now have wifi everywhere. As an IT guy this was easy to set up. Love the touch screen and stylis that comes with each one. Like the flexibility of these as I have tied them into the Alexis amazon dot. I will be adding a nest and other devices soon. Like the almond app for Android which allows you to see your devices, liable each one and restrict them based on groups. The Alexis from amazon and the almond smart home app allows you to verbally disable devices like kids network devices or turn on and off your guest network when you want to.
customer_reviews.author: The Butcher

customer_reviews.title: This worked great for a while
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for a while. But for whatever reason, it caused issues with our wifi. It was like our wifi thought it was an intruder piggy backing off our service or something. We ended up having to change the name of our wifi and our password up to twice a day. Calls to Comcast didn't help. I told my husband I thought this extender was the issue, and sure enough we haven't had a problem since we unhooked it. Not sure if everyone would have the same issue or not. Was pretty disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: David Shurick

customer_reviews.title: Works as wifi extender only!
customer_reviews.text: Works fine for a wifi extender... but remote access, security functionality, and basically every other feature advertised do not work. If you only want a wifi extender, find another for $20-25, as functionality is basically the same for this. UPDATE: Wifi extender functionality quit barely over 30 days, so now not able to return. Total waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: james sager

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I have never been happier with a product bought with no expectations of it really working. I have tried several routers and extenders in the past and was getting desperate when I tried this one. Wow! A large two story house and all four power indicator bars everywhere. Even out side to my farthest corners of the lot. We have .22 acres. I haven't used it to control any utilities yet, but have no doubt I will have total success there as well. It sat up to the internet without any problem and all software and app controls loaded with perfect ease. Thank you Almond, for solving a very old problem and setting me up for Tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Jolls

customer_reviews.title: Best router ever!
customer_reviews.text: Trust me, all the other reviews are not lying! The radius on this router is nothing short of amazing! Not only do I get Wi-Fi in my entire house, but I get it in every nook and cranny of my yard as well. I even get signal at most of my neighbors house s not only do I get Wi-Fi in my entire house, but I get it in every nook and cranny of my yard as well. I even get signal at most of my neighbors houses! Believe me, if you're in the market for a router this is definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: kevtlas

customer_reviews.title: Love it. It does exactly what it says it ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. It does exactly what it says it would. It covers the entire space and no drop in signal or quality although I have approximately 8 devices connected to it (wireless and hard) all the time. I would've liked to have more ports (2 extra) but not a big deal. I was surprised to see how small and compact the router is. I was expecting something bigger. Happy with the purchase so far. Will adjust the rating if needed later on.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Use two as range extenders
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Securifi Almond. Set up took less then five minutes. I use both as range extenders, placing them at opposite ends of home (router is in middle). Securifi caught my router signal immediately, requested password, and connected. I used my Amazon Fire to test signal (WiFi Analyzer app) the Ipad/Iphone does not have an app for testing WiFi signal strength to my knowledge. The Wifi Analyzer app provides a ping signal and strength meter. I walked around my home and found the weakest area to set my Securifi. Once setup, the "almond" signal from the range extender improved 30-50%., even works good in backyard. The touch screen provides a multitude of information and is user friendly..
customer_reviews.author: San Miguel

customer_reviews.title: EVERYTHING should be this easy!!
customer_reviews.text: (I am not compensated in any form for this review.) I don't write reviews often, but I can't say enough about this little powerhouse of s router. Replacing an older Linksys that became erratic and coming in at the size of two bread slices, this router is the fastest, simplest device you'll ever install. Takes only a few minutes and you're done. Steps are minimal, and the color touchpad makes it a breeze. The remote app allows control of modules that can turn on and off lights or other devices remotely. This little gem does what it says, and stands as a model for other manufacturers. Not for everyone, but perfect for most. You'll love it...
customer_reviews.author: Christopher R. Chaffee

customer_reviews.title: The high ratings persuaded me to give them a try and so far I am very satisfied. At Securify they are awfully polite and seem ..
customer_reviews.text: I usually stick with Netgear because of ease of set up. But I am completely impressed by the Almond 2015. The high ratings persuaded me to give them a try and so far I am very satisfied. At Securify they are awfully polite and seem to want to please a lot. I will definitely recommend them to my friends and clients. I will also buy more of their stuff.
customer_reviews.author: miguel

customer_reviews.title: Works Just Like it Says....No more dropped connections in the back yard!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install. You don't have to be tech savvy to install this product. All you have to do is follow the on screen prompts. Don't forget to select the Almond router as your network preference on your computer or tablet after it has installed itself. I used mine as a range extender. Plugged it into an electrical socket in a discreet spot in the kitchen which is halfway between my existing router and the previously annoying "dead zone". Now I can watch movies in the hot tub outside without losing wifi connection! It think a Jane Austen marathon is in order! Signed, Gary's happy wife.
customer_reviews.author: AKV

customer_reviews.title: It's as easy as can be
customer_reviews.text: It's as easy as can be. I have Internet in my shop now that's 250' away and is a steel sided building. Had signal from the almond right away and after moving it around different locations now have full signal and my shop computer runs just as fast as it does in the house hard wired. This is a really great product....If your looking to extend the range I really don't think you will be upset with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Mark Seiler

customer_reviews.title: One Bright Nighlight
customer_reviews.text: I bought the product as a replacement for my current router which I have to restart several times a week and with the belief that this had a longer wireless range. It took me three minutes all right, to determine that this was somehow incompatible with my computer, I had not internet, can't remember the messages, but that should not have been a problem. I tried it as a range extender and it worked exactly as well as the $20 device I had been using previously. This may work just fine for some, but it didn't work for me. Also the display seems to be on all the time, is that energy efficient? Is it necessary?
customer_reviews.author: Curtis G. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: So a bit of a learning curve if you're using ...
customer_reviews.text: So a bit of a learning curve if you're using a tablet. Almond app won't install on any tablet thru google play including the new gen fire/ Wouldn't install on 4.1, 5.1 or 6.1. Chatted with Almond and they emailed me the APK that will install on all. Have no idea why its not downloadable. You have to be connected to Almond threw it's wifi to register the system. You can block specific devices and you can make rules. The coolest thing is you can use LAN on the remote Almonds to wire directly to the extender. So it cut down on a lot of devices using Wifi.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Pheil

customer_reviews.title: Wifi extender that works!
customer_reviews.text: This really works! We were having a horrible time keeping the connection to our internet. The main unit was on the firsy floor of our house but we couldn't get internet in our family room in the basement or up in bedrooms. We now get it everywhere, even in the attic! The price was also reasonable. I researched the brand and I am glad we got it. Also easy to set up!
customer_reviews.author: AshD.

customer_reviews.title: Bad QC. Maybe third time will be a charm?
customer_reviews.text: Two bad router in a row. One with a screen that was broken (lines obscuring the right side of the screen), and another with a broken touch screen function. Serious problems with quality control of the screen components. I have an Almond+ that is great. I was really hoping to get an Almond 3...But maybe I will end up with something else.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Hodge

customer_reviews.title: so worth it. no headaches
customer_reviews.text: im a geek and this thing was simple and easy to setup. i was also very surprised at the speed boost and coverage. I have used so many wifi units and expensive ones $200 + $300 units. and to be very honest this unit actually works better. personally I'm going to be returning my $300 netgear x4 and picking up this to replace it. and use my second almond unit as an extension. its so flipping simple to setup.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: No longer tethered to computer! So Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: The Almond took only a few minutes to set up. It is worlds beyond the old "download drivers" wifi routers. I needed something that wasn't tethered to a computer for setup, or required downloaded drivers, as I just got rid of my laptop and now use only a tablet. I use it as a router and it works great. It has excellent coverage of my entire home. The touchscreen setup menu also made it super easy to input my own unique name and password. I can also easily go in and view the password on the touchscreen if I need to. Very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: C. L. Smart

customer_reviews.title: blurry screen
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product based on the five star reviews I read on Amazon. Installation was very easy and fast, but I've benn having issues with this product and I have only been using it for less than a month. My Almond screen looks blurry, I tried disconnecting and connecting it again but it is still blurry so I can't see the Menu and modify the configuration menu. I have my Almond on my first floor, and the signal I got on the second floor is terrible. It keeps disconnecting every time although I have full signal. I am in Peru right now so it's impossible for me to return the product.
customer_reviews.author: rosa maria

customer_reviews.title: good looking range extender/bridge worthy of being kept in sight.
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a booster antenna I was using to pull in a marginal signal but the previous booster needed a PC/USB connection to work. This allowed me to go 100% no-PC. It still pulled in the signal that the Roku wouldnt get on its own so it's obviously got a decent rx booster inside. Super easy setup. It'll guide you to an online acct but that's only needed if you've got home automation senses to remote control; I don't. I did call tech support for a problem with the online acct which I didnt need. Excellent support guy. The touchscreen has a couple apps for Clock and Weather so you dont have to hide this box once its configured.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Securify is Reinventing WiFi
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product with good range and ease of use. The best thing about Securify is the tech support! Because of a few quirks of my own installations I have made two support calls. In each case the tech was extremely helpful and even went ahead and n=made certain that the entire system was working perfectly after my issue was resolved. I have three Securify routers. After purchasing the first and being impressed with the support I purchased two more for a new location. One is used as a router and one as a range extender. The entire setup is far superior to my previous router/extender combo.
customer_reviews.author: Harvonium

customer_reviews.title: Beware of software change
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Almond 18 months ago and it was reasonable easy to setup and has been pretty reliable. The free iPhone app for remote monitoring of connected devices was very useful. However, the company has recently made "upgrades" which made the app incompatible with the router, as shown by recent ratings of Almond in the App Store. DO NOT BUY UNTIL THIS PROBLEM IS CORRECTED AND CONFIRMED BY REVIEWS IN THE APP STORE.
customer_reviews.author: jlit

customer_reviews.title: Very happy user.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good product and very user friendly. I am using 2 almonds as range extenders to get internet and Amazon Fire TV from about 200 feet from the main modem/router. My internet comes in fine with only 1 almond placed about mid-way, but depending on weather conditions I need the second almond, placed near my Fire Stick to get my Fire TV to work fast with very little buffering. I would suggest going to Securifi's website to get information on all their products and how they communicate with each other and your smart phone before ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Pain to set up but WORTH IT!
customer_reviews.text: First the bad. This took two 30 minute phone calls to set up in the range extender mode. If you are expecting three minutes set-up, as advertised, you will be sorely disappointed. That said, the team at Securifi will walk you through all the obstacles. The good. Oh my gosh IT WORKS. For the first time in years, I have excellent coverage in portions of my house that would drop the internet connection all the time. I can download movies quickly. Live streaming works well too. Worth every penny and worth the bother of setting up.
customer_reviews.author: My Three Sons

customer_reviews.title: FABULOUS!!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product. I'm using it as a range extender and it does the job exceedingly well. It's beautiful to look at and sits on the corner of a table. The Software provides several functions, including weather, clock, etc. For me, it's a lovely, unobtrusive clock. No on would know what its real function is! Customer service is equally excellent. They were easy to reach, took all the time required to be sure all questions were answered, software was updated as needed and that the Almond was working as required by the user. They even called me and emailed me to check on my satisfaction with its operation. Outstanding! Do not hesitate to purchase this item.
customer_reviews.author: crazedshopper

customer_reviews.title: Needs a lot of trial and error to get set up.
customer_reviews.text: Based on the advertising, it is able to be set up in less than 3 minutes, however, getting your electrical devices all connected is another situation all together. I walked away after becoming lost in the network setup. As of now, I haven't jumped back into it. I will attempt it again when I have done some more research. I think when it's all done, and everything is back on my network, I will really like it.I did receive a email from the company that makes this product asking for feedback. I wish he would contact me again, I could really use some help getting my devices connected to this router.
customer_reviews.author: DLF Dup24chv

customer_reviews.title: WiFi signal severely decreased with this unit in place.
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed witjh this product. I wanted to use it as a signal extender to increase my internet speed in and around the first floor. My router is upstairs on the second floor. I performed a speed test before I set it up and got 157 mbps download and 22 mbps upload. After connecting this as a wifi extender, I performed the same test and found I got 43 mbps download and 14 mbps upload. This actually decreased my wifi performance. I have given it two stars for packaging and presentation but not worth fooling with.
customer_reviews.author: C-LOS

customer_reviews.title: Great...so far!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! We've had this router/extender for only a few weeks and haven't had any big problems. I did have to COMPLETELY shut down and restart everything just now, because our Kindles were not responding to Wi-Fi. After doing that, everything is working properly. If this problem continues...I will update this review and contact Securifi to see if they have any suggestions to correct the problem. Time will tell. I do know that I'm not using this unit to it's FULL potential yet, but as I delve into it more, I'll learn more. Hope this makes sense to you all...if not...ask! Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent range and super easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this as my main wireless router and I'm highly impressed. I've had it for about a week now and I couldn't be happier. It took under 5 minutes to setup and it didn't need to be hooked up to a computer. I have a 2 story house with a basement and I get full reception on my devices everywhere I go, including outside in my yard. This is also noticeably faster than my old Linksys I had and doesn't randomly lose wifi. I couldn't be happier with this router.
customer_reviews.author: Otto

customer_reviews.title: Decent device, great company!
customer_reviews.text: Our Almond eventually, the screen developed problems and it would not access the software update. Securifi was incredibly helpful in troubleshooting and is sending a new replacement, per warranty. The Almond was great until these issues and the company was a pleasure to deal with on the phone.
customer_reviews.author: BubbaChive207

customer_reviews.title: The set is very easy, Having a touchscreen makes a huge difference
customer_reviews.text: I have successfully use the Almond as a network extender. The set is very easy, Having a touchscreen makes a huge difference! I was in need of an ethernet connection on a remote place, the Almond have made it possible. I have used an AT&T myfi to provide network to the Almond via wifi and then i have used one of the ethernet port of the Alomond to provide network to an "old" equipment. Note: I have not been able to provide network to the Almond via my iPhone 4S hotspot (some issue with IP acquisition). The issue is probably belong to the phone as the mifi was working.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Louvrier Raphael

customer_reviews.title: built in display is hugely useful
customer_reviews.text: You'll never want another router without a built-in display for configuration. The coverage provided by two of these in a mesh is great in a house made from challenging materials. Remember that the mesh feature NEEDS the 5ghz channel turned on. Did the run-around with support for at least 90 min before I figured out myself that 5ghz needed to be enabled.
customer_reviews.author: DaleQ

customer_reviews.title: OK but need refinement
customer_reviews.text: PRO + Has a touch screen display. You can configure the router without connecting it to a computer + manufacturer has its own web site and hosts a user forum CON - Reboot takes more than 1 minute 15 seconds and many setting changes require a reboot - there is no pure wireless bridge mode. It can be used as a wireless bridge in the range extender mode. However, it would range extend your wifi signal, even if you don't want it. Extending wifi signal beyond your property is an annoyance to your neighbor and also increases your exposure to hack attempts. I didn't use it with the home automation feature so I'm reviewing it as a wireless router only.
customer_reviews.author: Piu

customer_reviews.title: Wireless Lan Extender and Home Control/Security
customer_reviews.text: Set-up is easy as advertised. Use as Range Extender is excellent; as it boosted 2.4 Ghz Netgear at 1-4 bars to full 5 bars signal well beyond footprint of 2900sf. home. Still evaluating Home Automation capabilities. Did successfully join (or paired) 7 Devices; only one switch did not pair-up; not a problem with Almond itself. See also review for Sensors/Devices. I suggest Amazon needs to sell more (Securifi- Zigbee HA1.2 compatible) Security "local output" signaling devices; more than just Peanut Plug and "Smart"-Lights... For use as Home Security, Alarm/Strobe and Alert/Control Station specifically, there are "approved" compatible devices available, but these are not yet sold in U.S.A., much less Amazon, yet.
customer_reviews.author: DocP

customer_reviews.title: Less than 2 yrs. old and no longer works
customer_reviews.text: After less than 2 years, used as a WiFi extender, the Almond seems to be fatally flawed. It goes to a white screen where you can do nothing, and have to unplug it. While it did work, it would occasionally drop the connection, needing me to go through the menu and re-connect it. When booting up it's quite slow, so when you do have to re-cnnect it, expect to be there for 5+ minutes. For $119 It's a disappointment. If you only need a WiFi extender; not a router, don't waste your money. go with something else.
customer_reviews.author: Mary C Till

customer_reviews.title: Securifi Almond 2015 - May be good for a PC but with a MAC not so much.
customer_reviews.text: After having done a lot of research and reading reviews about this product, I stepped out on the limb and purchased. Installation was not as easy for a Mac as purported for a PC. Router is located in an upstairs office and needed to expand the network for guest and for streaming on television. Unless I have received a defective model, this is Hit and Miss at best. After purchasing, I purchased a different brand of Network Expander and that thing is giving me coverage in the entire house. I use the Almond as an expensive paperweight. Tech support was not much help so, it gets three (3) stars and I am being generous.
customer_reviews.author: Jiggy955

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a while and then....
customer_reviews.text: I keep on getting no signal because it says "Couldn't get IP address" I've reset it a couple times but it won't keep a steady signal. I'm using it as a wifi extender. I can use the regular wifi and it works, just not the extender with the almond. Disappointing for what I paid for this I thought it would be better.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Stratton

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful tech support
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an Almond 3, three months ago. It was very easy to set up and worked very well up until today. I needed to power cycle both my router and modem, something I had done in the past without issue. For some reason the unit, which I was using as an extender, no longer detected any of the wireless networks available. None of the suggestions I found online in help forums worked. I called tech support and I was patiently talked through the steps necessary to get everything back to normal. I can't say enough good things about the quality of tech support I received!
customer_reviews.author: MDC

customer_reviews.title: Trial an ?.
customer_reviews.text: I was unable to activate the Z-wave dongle because of the site that came up was Asian script. Because of time constrains I was not able to utilize it's function. now I'm 1600 miles away from it for at least 6 mos. Also two of the almonds are not communicating with 3 of my Nest Cameras as of 5/12/17.they functioned great until then, is there anyway to communicate with the home router to activate the other two they are no further then 24 feet away with one wooden wall with sheetrock between them. Respectfully, GB
customer_reviews.author: Car Nut

customer_reviews.title: Securifi Almond 2015: You can't go wrong with this little baby!
customer_reviews.text: Securifi Almond 2015: This little thing has to be the easist thing I have ever installed and it started working right away. I finally have robust wifi access in an are of my home that I was only getting 2 bars to none with my previous connection. I love the touch screen and stylus to do everything except the part I needed to do from a tablet or phone of pc, which was to signup and verify an account. I set it up as a separate wifi network, rather than an extender. I get wifi clear out to my street and 3 houses up. I can actually mow my yard now utilizing wifi rather than 3G data usage.
customer_reviews.author: TechFreakBob

customer_reviews.title: Very good!
customer_reviews.text: From all WIFI routers, switches and access-points this is the best without any doubt. I am using it as AC (Access-Point). From what I see, playing with it, the 3 minutes setup may be true as long as you are using it the way it creators thought you are going to use it. If you step out of this path the setup becomes nightmarish. I need it as static IP access-point. There is no simple way to achieve this configuration. The support is nice, answers quickly but has no clue how network works. I own, also the previous version. The 2015, definitely has more power and reach. I didn't test, yet the ZigBee feature.
customer_reviews.author: ST

customer_reviews.title: Great router, easy set up
customer_reviews.text: This router was so easy to set up- it only took a matter of minutes. The touchscreen interface is really useful and a unique feature, and I love that the router comes with a built-in stylus to use with the touchscreen. Having the Almond app on my phone makes changing settings even easier, as I don't even have to be home to do it. Although it certainly isn't crucial to the function of the router, I like that the touchscreen can display the weather or a clock as well. We've had no problems setting up devices to connect or having devices stay connected to the router, which we had with our past router. So far, we really love our Almond!
customer_reviews.author: KA

customer_reviews.title: Overheating problems
customer_reviews.text: At first it was great and a cool router, only one with a screen. The problems started 2 months after when the screen would go blank and the WiFi. I had to buy a fan specifically for the router just so it wouldn’t over heat, because of this I give it a two star but besides that it is a good router. It’s just really inconvenient to have been doing this for two years. After two years the router now is extremely slow in terms of transmitting all the megabits of data that I’m proved by my internet provider. Extremely over price for the time it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Drops wifi connection
customer_reviews.text: At the cost of $120, this should be a very good router. It ought to be much better than the one I got rid of. (should have kept it.) It works fine for a while and then drop, drop, drop. A second Almond 3 would be another $120. I'm planning to buy something that has great reviews and isn't this expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Super Sue

customer_reviews.title: Excellent extender/router but dodgy weather app
customer_reviews.text: Bought the Almond 2015 primarily as a wireless extender and it works really well for this purpose. Easy to set up, really good range and very nice visual interface. My only issue is that the weather app (which is one of the reasons I went with this router) only works sporadically. Customer support is very good and they tried to fix it but no luck. Apparently the weather app will be fixed with the next firmware upgrade and when it is, I'll be giving it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: DES NJ

customer_reviews.title: I cannot express enough how much I love this!!
customer_reviews.text: We have several electronics and gaming systems on the same WiFi, that were constantly lagging. I ended up looking for a WiFi booster. I came across this item and it caught my eye with its many features. Item was delivered quickly and setup was easy. Right away, everyone noticed how fast our internet was going. I cannot express enough how much I love this product. Now I can watch my movies without my tv freezing up!
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Carnahan

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for streaming issues & Great customer service & support
customer_reviews.text: This has been a solution to re-buffering issues while streaming movies & Netflix for me! Easy set up, I did have some issues since I did not chose the Almond extension for my WiFi, but customer service was EXCELLENT!!!! Walked me right through the set up & verified it was working & even provided a follow up call. My only complaint is that went power flickers during a storm I have to reset up the Almond. But now that I know that happens it is not as big of an issue for me. The first time it happen I was afraid my new found solution was not as through as I had anticipated.
customer_reviews.author: Mary J Paladino

customer_reviews.title: A coworker had this one and recommended it, and I thought I would take the ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to replace my router (Linksys) which was dropping internet and rebooting randomly. A coworker had this one and recommended it, and I thought I would take the jump. Unfortunately the software was out of date so while it set up fine no internet. I was a bit miffed, but the walk through help section on the website told me how to get the software downloaded (did it via my phone and transferred via usb) and installed and then it connected perfectly and I've had no issues sense. I live in a decent size 1 bedroom so I haven't had to use the range extender, but as far as a router goes works just fine these past couple weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Afura

customer_reviews.title: Beware...this is NOT a '3 minute install'....
customer_reviews.text: Not at ALL a 3 minute install. <sigh> Not in the slightest. Make SURE that you have recently reset your router/WiFi, make sure you're close to your source, have several means of logging on to their very flaky 'code generation server', and beware...our first Almond develped a screen fault within 20 minutes of operation. The second took FOUR HOURS to install. We'll get a Surfboard next time...
customer_reviews.author: Aeryn Saint

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Have a rectangular 3 story house, with the office / router on the north side of the 3rd floor. Have had weak signal on the south side of the first and second floors regardless of the routers we tried over the last 5 years. 3 x Almond 3s (1 each floor) solved in minutes. Also added the water detector in the basement (again simple install) and it also works seamlessly.
customer_reviews.author: DJER

customer_reviews.title: Yep, less than 3 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: Easiest home setup of a router I've done so far. It's all menu driven and it was a piece of cake. Signal strength on the other side of the house is far and away better than with our old router, I don't think I need another Almond as a range extender but I might get one if I want to go further out on the property (like my workshop in the next lot over). I did have to do a hard reboot a few days ago (hence 4 stars instead of 5).
customer_reviews.author: Phantom Cruiser

customer_reviews.title: The setup was easy, and I really enjoy the touchscreen built into ...
customer_reviews.text: The setup was easy, and I really enjoy the touchscreen built into the almond. I set mine up in bridge mode, hard wired to another router, and use it as a second wireless AP, with two other devices hardwired into the almond. So far this thing has been more reliable and higher signal strength then my current TMobile AC900, despite the almond being the farthest away, and buried behind a bunch of computer equipment. The only potential issue I have seen is a column of dead pixels on the on-board display.
customer_reviews.author: MrPersonGuy

customer_reviews.title: and it works great in my huge old 2 story house
customer_reviews.text: My first Wifi set up and it did take me longer than 3 minutes because I don't understand all the tech lingo, but I did figure it out , and it works great in my huge old 2 story house. This all started out with the Windows 10 download, which wouldn't connect with my old printer, so I bought a new wireless printer not understanding that I needed WiFi. Duh! If I can set up the Almond, so can you.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly

customer_reviews.title: The Router/extender worked for about 30minutes and went blank. ...
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the second router - it is working very nicely. The setup is maybe 10 minutes, to finish completely. The signal is very strong throughout the entire house. I guess there is a manufacturing problem that leads to a crap shoot - either you get a good one or a bad one. The Router/extender worked for about 30 minutes and went blank. Unplugged it, waited for 5 minutes, plugged it back in, still dead. Pressed the reset button, still nothing. Since I am a glutton for punishment I have asked for a replacement. Hope the replacement works longer than the original! Never could get the link up to work either. 3minutes??? Get serious.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B.

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars to the COMPANY, 3 for the product.
customer_reviews.text: The product is more like 3 stars, because the screen stops working! Other than that it is awesome product! The company is very easy to deal with and are committed to their customers! That being said, let's focus on the product. It is a great idea, has an app that goes with it. A stylus to work with. You can have the screen set to show clock or wether! Haven't tried it as an extender, but the router has a fair range. Lots of options and settings! Give it a try!
customer_reviews.author: Geet T.

customer_reviews.title: LCD screen defective after 2 months.
customer_reviews.text: Range is good, set up is easy but after less than 2 months of use the screen has become white around the edges and the white area is expanding by the day. Defective LCD screen? I don't know but I'm rather disappointed that it has gone out so quickly. Will have to contact customer service. Will update review depending on how my customer service experience goes.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Almost an instant improvement in WiFi strength
customer_reviews.text: I live in a log cabin where three heavy log walls separate the study from living room where the TV is located. I have fibre, but could only get two of four bars of service for streaming Amazon Prime and Netflix. We had constant problems with both services disconnecting from the Internet. Received this Almond only two days after ordering. Set in the same room as the TV, plugged it in, selected my language, selected the primary Wireless router, selected "Range Extender" from the touch screen and in less than 30 seconds, I had a full wireless signal. No more dropped packets and HD looks fantastic. I definitely recommend this device.
customer_reviews.author: GWR

customer_reviews.title: Really cool router!
customer_reviews.text: Didn't have much luck trying to use it as an extender but I think I had it too far from my base router. Have been using it as my main router and we love it. Really like being able to acces it from my phone. It lets me know when someone new joins the network and I can restart it without having to go to the base. Reason I only gave it a 4 is cause I had an issue trying to get my receiver to connect by hard line but it connects wirelessly just fine. Thought it was maybe the receiver but my other router didn't have an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Starkey

customer_reviews.title: Love this router!
customer_reviews.text: I had a Comcast modem/router for years, and a few months ago, I switched solely to Internet tv. I always lost signal or lost crazy time to buffering in the upstairs bedrooms. Got sick of paying the rental fee, so I bought this Almond router and a Motorola Surfboard modem. I'm truly getting top speeds, and buffering and lost signals upstairs have gone away completely. Also, I'm slightly tech savvy, but not in IT or even terribly good with IT. I set this up with no problem, quickly, and easily. I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: It'sJess

customer_reviews.title: Securifi Almond is a super product
customer_reviews.text: This unit is so much better than the NetGear Routers and Extenders I had purchased in the past for a much higher cost. In fact my daughter placed an order for the Almond 2015 today after witnessing my excitement about the new router. Also she liked the strong signal on her iPhone. I did purchase the Almond plain unit first but decided to buy the Almond 2015 and use the original router as an extender. The installation was a snap. I'm glad I found your product on the Web.
customer_reviews.author: B Kuler

customer_reviews.title: Good, reliable router
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace a malfunctioning Netgear router about 6 months ago. It has worked flawlessly since then. Setup was quick and simple. The case is plastic and the whole unit very light, so long cables may need some sort of strain relief (I located it in a corner of my office where this is not a problem). We have a number of devices that are wirelessly connected to this router and haven't seen any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Tom S.

customer_reviews.title: A very good range extender
customer_reviews.text: I bought to use when my wife & I travel. I've been using it my home, and found it gives a strong signal. I especially like the ability to set it up independent of a computer. We love our iPads, but they are not real helpful in dealing with network issues. We are about to make an extended overseas trip. Previous experience tells me there will be public WiFi, but the signal in the apartment will be weak. Our plan is to put the Almond in the window... I don't have any experience with Almond as a wireless router, but I am impressed with it's simple common-sense interface.
customer_reviews.author: Richard McCain

customer_reviews.title: Good, simple cost effective router.
customer_reviews.text: I’m comparing it to my old 8+ netgear wireless router. Speed had definitely increased. I am purchasing 15mbps and am now getting 15-16 mbps testing with speedtest.org with this router as compared to about 10-12 mbps. Even 2 levels below the router I am getting 14 mbps for the PS4. Set up was easy - touch screen is nice. My only concern with this router is that maybe every week or so the speed drops to less than 1mpbs and I can figure out why. I just go up stairs and reboot the router and then speed is back up to 15 mbps.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Spidell

customer_reviews.title: So Worth It.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 3 pack because I have a large house and so I needed the extra push for signal. I have one of the older Almonds for years and it worked well. However since adding more items inside and outside of house I needed to expand the connection. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Boriqua Baby

customer_reviews.title: This thing works!
customer_reviews.text: This thing works! I needed to extend my wifi to reach the other end of my ranch house. Set up is easy with the touch screen (the touchscreen stylus stores in the bottom of the unit). If your wifi has a password you will need it to finish the set up. It allows you to name the new network or you can use the default. Anyone using a password protected Almond extended wifi network will have to enter the password at least once. Even though the goal is to extend your existing network I suggest placing the unit as close to the primary network signal as you can so that you are extending a strong signal.
customer_reviews.author: Brunswick Rich

customer_reviews.title: This router worked for me.
customer_reviews.text: When I switched over to Verizon some years ago I bought the router/modem instead of renting it. I was having trouble getting wi-fi to the other side of my house recently so thought I would use the Securifi Almond for a booster. After much trouble I found out the Verizon router was only reaching the room that it was in so I hard wired the Securifi Almond to the old router and that took care of it. Getting wi-fi all through the house now without having to replace the original router/modem.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Easy, and best yet.... It works.
customer_reviews.text: We had the Apple time capsule and need to extend the range. After reading a blog of issues others had trying to do this with available Apple products, I decided to give this a try. For our 3000 sq ft two level home and yard, two covered it amply (we replaced the time capsule and added an extender). We built a studio building, and since I didn't want to increase my cable bill further to bring internet out there, I added a third almond for the studio. Problem solved. It said it was a three minute set up, but I think I had it done (once everything was unpackaged) in under two minutes! I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Glaser

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Quick easy set up as advertised. I am using as an extender and works well. I can't say how it works as a router because I have not used it as such. I bought one for home and one for our DQ store. Works well both spots. As a follow up after using for two years I want to say their customer service and tech support are great. I have had problems with the screen fading out and not being able to read. After talking to them and explaining my problem, they have replaced the two I had problems with. They do care about their customers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Longevity questionable...
customer_reviews.text: We used this as a range extender in our home, and it seemed to do that fine. Setup was not difficult at all. Would have been a four-star rating, but the unit just died - 11 months after purchase. It was not abused or exposed to moisture or extreme conditions - in fact it was probably only touched a couple of times after being put into service. This weekend we noticed it was no longer accessible, and it would not reboot or reset. I am going to attempt a warranty claim, but frankly I don't want another Almond which might die in a similar fashion. An $80 unit should last longer than a year or two.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen W.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, easy set up
customer_reviews.text: Great product, I've been using a previous model for a couple years and needed another one to increase my wifi capacity. Easy to set up and the built it touch interface is easy to use and convenient. Two complaints (although they are really just suggestions to the manufacturer): 1) Setting it up as just an access point instead of a router is very easy, but the placement and need set that option is not obvious; 2) the interface changed significantly from the last model to accommodate new home automation functions, enough to make it annoying and it the re-arrangement seemed unnecessary.
customer_reviews.author: J. Balshaw

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: I had nothing but problems out of this thing trying to connect a ps3 to it. Tried more than one and hours with customer service. Customer service was excellent however. I ended up using a different brand that worked immediately. It may be perfect for other setups though. This was in 2015 so it may be fixed now.
customer_reviews.author: JEFF L MCGEE

customer_reviews.title: Have to restart daily
customer_reviews.text: I've had many different routers/extenders and I like the concept of this one. I was hoping to put five stars, and when it's working it deserves five, however, I have to restart the router on a daily basis. That's just not acceptable to me, especially when I'm in the middle of something important and suddenly lose connection.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: ... purchased the first unit it appeared to be working nicely and easy setup
customer_reviews.text: when I purchased the first unit it appeared to be working nicely and easy setup. But then it continually failed and I called the help line and went thru several ways to boot it back up. When it once again appeared to be working well, I purchased another unit to extend beyond the first unit but it didn't work and after several times on with the help folks in India, I have now requested a refund and using another brand. I loved the idea of the lid screed and easy setup but it has failed. And to boot, the operator told me that they only recommend a 5o foot distance from the host.
customer_reviews.author: chiefnac

customer_reviews.title: Close to perfect but not quite there.
customer_reviews.text: My Securifi Almond just stopped working. No notice. It just stopped after two + years. I like the 3 minute set up so much I replaced it with the Amond 2015. Up and running in 2-3 minutes. I did not use it as a router or access point though I would like to use it for the latter as I did in another home. Only thing unusual is that the screen doesn't go dark after a setting change for a day or two. Odd? Anyway, let's see how long this one lasts. Still the best customer service on a technical device anywhere. Another great reason to buy these Securifi devices.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: Over all this is a good router/extender. Here is few negatives
customer_reviews.text: Over all this is a good router/extender. Here is few negatives: 1) any changes take about 2 minutes to save, probably i am being impatient. 2) the unit does not have any rubber cushions at the bottom so it is light weight so it can slip and fall easily. Not a biggie, but nice to have. 3) The touch screen does not have screen saver, so i am worried about the screen burns and wastage of power. That's all i can think off, over all happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Deenadayal Yakkali

customer_reviews.title: easy setup
customer_reviews.text: - Easy installation and setup. - I purchased this based on a recommendation from a friend but found out that I needed (wanted) more that this unit would allow. I wanted more range and signal strength, which this unit did not provide. I eventually purchased an Asus repeater and it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: S. Shoji

customer_reviews.title: Super easy setup and works great
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to set up! I'm using it to extend my wifi due to concrete block walls near my router. So I ran CAT 5e cable to this unit on the other side of my house. It's great that it can use the same AP name as my main router so there's no need to change between two different network names. The touchscreen made set up a breeze, and like the apps that run on it too. I can check the weather as I walk by.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brosch

customer_reviews.title: As advertised the Almond was very easy to set up and get operational
customer_reviews.text: As advertised the Almond was very easy to set up and get operational. I'm sure the Almond works great for certain applications but for me I don't see the results I was looking for. I based my purchase on reading several reviews so I was hopeful that I would experience improved signal from my hotspot internet source as some of the reviewers stated they had. Living in the country our internet options are limited and so I thought the Almond would possibly enhance our signal throughout our home but it is not to be.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Working well as range extender
customer_reviews.text: Have owned it for a couple of weeks now, and it's been working great as a wi-fi signal amplifier/extender. Devices connected to wi-fi now receive an excellent signal in a rear bedroom, where before it oscillated between semi-strong and very weak. I wish it had the option to plug the unit in directly to an outlet without the cord, so it didn't have to rest on the floor. Luckily, there was an outlet behind some furniture that was available, where it remains out of view. I'm happy with both the effectiveness and ease of use of the product.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: It is a very nice product and I am very pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: It is a very nice product and I am very pleased with it. I like the fact that it can be wall mounted and comes in two colors. I ended up returning the Almond 3 and converting to the Almond + because I like the longer-range feature on the later. Moreover, I thin that if you were to combine some of the features from the Almond 3 to those included in the Almond + you'd have a home run!
customer_reviews.author: Jose L. Trevino

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say first that I am not really tech savvy. This was so easy I was surprised. It did everything they advertised which is highly unusual in today's world. If you can plug in the wiring and read on-screen (Really simple!) instructions you can install this.I used it as a range extender and where I used to get limited coverage with lots of buffering I now get full coverage with no buffering. My phone now has 5 bars. Small enough to hide too. Great job Almond!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ron P.

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.text: Updated review and 4 stars to 2. I returned the product. Initially I had a difficult time connecting it to the internet via my router. I got it to work by hit and miss by changing the security settings. Now, a few days later, it says it's connected to my router but there is no internet connection. I can't spend anymore time trying to set it up so I'm returning it. The TP-Link A750 repeater is soooooo much better. Much easier to set up, cheaper and it works well as a wifi range extender.
customer_reviews.author: Verified/Frequent Buyer

customer_reviews.title: the set up was fast and easy. The best part is that I didn't need ...
customer_reviews.text: While it did take a little more than 3 minutes, the set up was fast and easy. The best part is that I didn't need a computer. I was able to give the unit a unique name and a unique password. The range is better than the TCP that I replaced. I have it on the ground floor and have no problem with signal strength anywhere in the house or the basement. I like that I get a notice every time a new device pairs with my modem. I recommend this modem and I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Tony C

customer_reviews.title: Would not purchase again
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how people sets this up in 3 minutes. I had to call for help to get mine set up and the modem lights are still not blinking correctly but the Almond seems to be working. I was able to get through to support quickly but the fellow I was speaking to was a little hard to understand and a bit rude. Only two slots to plug items in and I need three slots. I would not purchase again. Update November 2016 - Still not getting a good signal and have ordered a Linksys to take its place.
customer_reviews.author: Starseed23

customer_reviews.title: I am extremely pleased with the results
customer_reviews.text: I used the Securifi Almond as s range extender. I am extremely pleased with the results. There are a couple of interior brick walls in my home that were preventing wifi from reaching locations where it was needed. I set up the range extender and now have wifi thought my home. My neighbor clued me onto the Almond. I'm so glad he did. My only difficulty was with the written instructions. It could be my lack of tech acumen. My neighbor told me to "just plug the thing in, use the stilus found on bottom and follow the prompt for 'range extender.'" I'm a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: Lita

customer_reviews.title: This was a great, reasonably priced solution to our rather unique layout
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a range extender for our home network. It is located in a detached cottage and picks up the network signal from the main router in the house. The Almond then pushes the signal across the yard to the office which is located in yet another building. Setup was simple and customer support was very helpful when we had difficulty following upgrades to the main router and modem. This was a great, reasonably priced solution to our rather unique layout.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W

customer_reviews.title: tech support awesome! called because had trouble getting iPad up to ...
customer_reviews.text: using it as a router, I am in 4K sqft stucco house, get a strong signal through out entire house. tech support awesome! called because had trouble getting iPad up to high speed, i got disconnect and they called me right back, this router and company very user friendly:)
customer_reviews.author: Paul Brown

customer_reviews.title: It is very easy to set up the Almond 3
customer_reviews.text: It is very easy to set up the Almond 3. However the built in siren is very quite; I wouldn’t define it as a security siren. Also parent countrols and monitoring require additions subscription. I’m much happier with my Almond + so will be returning my Almond 3
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: I truly believe that the customer support is better than the product
customer_reviews.text: I truly believe that the customer support is better than the product. The product is fantastic! I needed the support as it was a little more difficult than I thought, but the customer support brought it home. My new 75" TV is working great, my signal around the house is fantastic. Great product and did I mention support!
customer_reviews.author: Donald Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Easy set-up, solid range extender, same network name, so everything I sought, I now have.
customer_reviews.text: Product just arrived and I set it up quickly and easily and never even had to look at a manual. I set up in Range Extender mode. I then switched to another function to try. I then reset it up again as a Range Extender which is why I purchased. I set it up as the same network as my main router. I took a tablet device into a former dead zone at far end of house and now have a full signal everywhere in the house including the former dead zone. Very pleased with a great start.
customer_reviews.author: Rob C

customer_reviews.title: I love the touch screen on the front for instant diagnosics ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. I love the touch screen on the front for instant diagnosics and setting up devices. I have an Almond + as my hub, and 2 Almond 3's as range extenders. I have connected one Peanut plug and with a little help from Securifi support I was up and running. Which leads me to another point. Support. I used the chat feature on their site to walk through setting up the Peanut plug on one of my range extenders, then connecting to my iPhone app, which allows me to control the plug from my phone. I will be buying more Peanut plugs in the very near future.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E. Garner

product_meta.title: Securifi AL3-WHT-US Almond 3 (White): Complete Smart Home Wi-Fi System - Easy to Set up Dual Band Gigabit Wi-Fi Router, Built-in Security Siren, Universally Compatible with modems - Works with Alexa
product_meta.description: Style:Almond 3 (1 Pack)| Color:White  Introducing the new Almond 3 Smart Home Wi-Fi System.   Makes every room in the house worth visiting.   Wi-Fi everywhere you want it. And we mean everywhere. Meet the Almond 3, our latest innovation that easily and quickly establishes a single, secure Home Wi-Fi System in minutes. To create a Home Wi-Fi Network, simply setup two or more Almond 3 units. It's easy with our innovative easy touchscreen access and Wizard.   Almond makes Wi-Fi easy. Plug the first Almond 3 into your ISP's modem. The other units just need power and will communicate with the first Almond 3 to create a single Wi-Fi network across your entire home.   Different homes, different Wi-Fi needs. One easy solution.How a family's yells can make it through any wall is an accepted fact. Wi-Fi signals on the other hand can struggle traveling from room to room. Sometimes concrete, glass and chicken wire (found inside historic home walls) diffuses or outright blocks a Wi-Fi signal. Other times it's the layout of a home that makes it difficult to get a signal everywhere. This is exactly why we created the best Smart Home Wi-Fi System. The Almond 3 gives you not only what you want, but what you need: reliable Wi-Fi covering your entire home, no matter what you live in.   Small HomeOne Almond 3 should do the trick for up to 1,300 square feet.   Medium HomeTwo Almond 3 units will give you the coverage you need on both floors up to 2,600 square feet. Large HomeFor homes larger than ...
feature_bullets: EASY SETUP: Ridiculously easy to set it up in minutes using the Touchscreen Wizard; NO PC/Mac/CD needed for Setup or Management
EXTENSIVE COVERAGE: Almond 3 covers 1,300 sq. Ft. Add extra Almond 3 units to create a network for total home Wi-Fi coverage
SPEED and RELIABILITY: Smart Home Wi-Fi System covers your entire home with Ultra Fast and reliable Wi-Fi.
INTEGRATED SUPPORT for Phillips Hue, Nest and Amazon Echo. UNIVERSALLY COMPATIBLE with almost all the ISP's modem/router (Comcast, Verizon, TimeWarner etc.). Security - WEP, WPA, WPA2
SMART HOME FUNCTIONALITY: Almond 3 doubles as a hub to transform your house into a Smart Home. REMOTELY ACCESS and CONTROL connected sensors using the free Almond iOS and Android apps

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars2,053 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
